courseSectionInformation: 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: HDFS 120.
description: Examines influence of economic, demographic and social changes on families in the U.S. and on the opportunities and life-chances of individual family members. Explores interactions of social class, poverty, race and gender and their effects on family life and on child and adolescent development. Includes critical analysis of employment, immigration, health care, family leave, welfare and other social policy options that affect family life. 3 undergraduate hours. 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: HDFS 120.
label: Family Diversity in the U.S.
